info.game_comments:
2007 College Championship semifinal game 3.
From the University of Southern California.

(1, 1).clue: On April 24, 1970 this country launched its first satellite, Mao 1

(3, 1).clue: On the flag of this largest island, white represents the ice that covers about 80% of it

(5, 1).clue: In 2007 this team beat Ohio State 84-75 to repeat as NCAA basketball champs

(6, 1).clue: Napoleon abdicated for the second time 4 days after this battle

(1, 2).clue: In 2011 MESSENGER is scheduled to orbit this planet named for a messenger god

(3, 2).clue: Her personal flag consists of a wreath of golden roses & a crown atop the letter "E", all on a blue field

(5, 2).clue: He won golf's Vardon Trophy, for the lowest adjusted scoring average, from 1999 to 2003 & again in 2005

(6, 2).clue: This country's soldiers are seen here rehearsing for May 7, 2004, the 50th anniversary of the Battle of Dien Bien Phu

(1, 3).clue: This spacecraft whose name is from Greek for "origin" collected solar wind particles & then returned to Earth

(3, 3).clue: This Australian state's flag features a red lion, just like the coat of arms of its capital, Hobart

(5, 3).clue: (I'm Pete Carroll, head football coach at USC.) Our 2 national titles at USC are still 4 short of this "animal" of an Alabama head coach, but we're working on that

(6, 3).clue: The Treaty of Ghent had already been signed when Andrew Jackson decisively won this Jan. 1815 battle

(1, 4).clue: In 1998 a craft named for him photographed volcanic plumes on Io, a Jovian moon he discovered in 1610

(2, 4).clue: Title, key or legend, compass rose

(3, 4).clue: The flag of the United Nations shows the world from the perspective of this spot

(4, 4).clue: Light you "carry" for an old flame(5)

(5, 4).clue: This team won the World Series every year from 1949 to 1953

(6, 4).clue: 300 Spartans led by Leonidas held off Persian troops for 3 days, until a traitor betrayed them, in this 480 B.C. battle

(1, 5).clue: Launched in 1977, this spacecraft is the most distant manmade object at more than 9.5 billion miles from Earth

(2, 5).clue: Safety pin, pressurized canister, hose, foam

(3, 5).clue: The flag of this nation seen here has flown since 1882; the flag of its neighbor to the north, since 1948

(5, 5).clue: (I'm USC athletic director Mike Garrett.) I won the 1965 Heisman as a USC RB; I'll let you off easy & have you name just one of 3 USC players who won it in the 21st century
(5, 5).correct response: (one of) Reggie Bush, Carson Palmer or Matt Leinart

(6, 5).clue: Norman cavalry are preparing to attack for a reenactment of this battle that took place in 1066

(1, 1).clue: A traditional Ugandan cloth is made from this part of the mutuba tree, softened by pounding

(2, 1).clue: The walls of Avila, with 88 towers, were built in the 11th C. by Christians fighting these people

(3, 1).clue: Armenia is the hub for speakers of Armenian; this country has the most speakers of Rundi

(4, 1).clue: Though Greek by ethnicity, the 2nd century physician was born in Anatolia in what's today this country

(5, 1).clue: Former Guns N' Roses members Duff, Slash & Matt Sorum reunited to form this pistol of a band

(6, 1).clue: This word, Hawaiian for "quick", is technology that allows for open access to add & change a page

(1, 2).clue: All Peace Corps volunteers in Africa are trained to instruct locals on stopping this retroviral epidemic

(2, 2).clue: Arundel Castle has been the seat of these noblemen of Norfolk for hundreds of years; the 18th one lives there now

(3, 2).clue: (Jon of the Clue Crew stands next to a monitor.) Kufic, named for the city of Kufa and often used for religious texts, is an ancient style of writing this most widely spoken Semitic language

(4, 2).clue: Galen studied medicine at Pergamum, Smyrna & this Egyptian city famous for a library & a lighthouse

(5, 2).clue: This New Mexico indie band named for leg parts is all the rage, & their "New Slang" was a hit in "Garden State"

(6, 2).clue: An O.S. can be an operating system as well as this type of software like Firefox, GIMP & Thunderbird

(1, 3).clue: When friends in Gabon meet, they give each other a series of 4 of these

(2, 3).clue: The numerically designed Castel del Monte in Italy has 8 towers around a courtyard of this shape

(3, 3).clue: Vi vill ha en smorgas och jordnotter--sorry, slipped into this language for a second

(4, 3).clue: One of Galen's medical breakthroughs was proving arteries carried blood & not this, as was believed

(5, 3).clue: This Brit's first name is a flower; her Myspace page & her "Smile" helped to launch her fame

(6, 3).clue: This phrase was used of an appliance that connected to an electrical outlet; now it's an add-on for a browser

(1, 4).clue: In 1990 Namibia became independent from this country that had controlled it for 75 years

(2, 4).clue: A castle was built at Vallandraut, France for the man who in 1309 moved this office to France for an extended stay

(3, 4).clue: It's the term used for Dutch as spoken in Belgium; in it, Antwerp is Antwerpen

(4, 4).clue: Galen might have sworn an oath to this 5th century B.C. Greek man he considered the beginning of all medical learning

(5, 4).clue: Chris Daughtry turned down the offer to sing for this band even after he covered their song "Hemorrhage"

(6, 4).clue: If you want to build a new you, create a toned, buff one of these online facsimiles in "Virtual Hills"

(1, 5).clue: A Senegalese cape shares the name of these islands that form an independent country to the west

(2, 5).clue: Even the peaceful Swiss needed their castles, like Chillon on this lake seen here

(3, 5).clue: "Battle" was "gefeoht" in this, the language spoken in London until about 1100

(4, 5).clue: Galen believed that blood was produced in this largest internal organ & that it ebbed & flowed like the tide

(5, 5).clue: YouTube helped this Arizona band's cover of OutKast's "Hey Ya!" surge in popularity

(6, 5).clue: You can get the New York Times or blogs in this type of XML format that's known as "really simple"

(0, 0).clue: In an Ibsen play, Nora tells her husband that she's been like one of these to him, just as she was to her father
